profile.name: Bernal
profile.title: Senior Software Developer looking for an unicorn
profile.description:
Hello.

I am Bernal Varela, Galician software developer from A Coruña, I have been working in what I like, creating software, since 2007 and loving computers since I have memory.

I'm a father of three, sports lover and cyclist when the weather allows it. I can't imagine my life without music, I play some instruments that give me peace of mind when I'm stressed. I like movies, video games, and board games.
This is what I like, but all the things that I like to do usually don't fit very well with my children's schedule.

How i'm i? I think I'm an optimistic and calm person with high level stress control, I like people, I like what I do and I like to do it well, I'm usually very demanding of myself and sometimes it stresses me. I am a curious person and I am used to evolving and trying to stay up to date with all the changes and updates of the technologies we are using.

location.notes: Autocompleted using Google Maps API (id: ChIJGQVeRvRfLg0RIMrJc4L1BAM)

challenges.description:
Working on the migration of the optimization platform. Creating a scalable architecture and decomposing the project into projects easier to maintain and understand.
Optimizing the system and improving the java code.
Database migration from a relational database (Aurora) to Snowflake’s Data Cloud.

Formador java Básico. 12 horas.

Queres Tecnología. (Polígono de Alvedro)

Formador Hibernate y Spring Avanzado. 40h

Bahia Software (Santiago de Compostela)

Formador Java, Hibernate, Spring. 16h

B the travel brand (Palma de Mallorca)

2018 - 2021
Working in the migration of the eCommerce platform of one of the biggest retail enterprises in the world. This platform is a monolith capable of attending 7000 - 9000 orders per minute in more than 60 countries, this was a limitation in moments of a big load and that's the reason why this enterprise takes the decision of migrating to microservices trusting in us to perform this job.
At this moment I'm the team leader of a group of 5 and we are developing 3 microservices of a total of 8 expected to attend more than 20.000 orders per minute.
Those microservices are developed using java 11 using spring boot as a framework and MongoDB, db2, WebSphere MQ, Kafka, rest (open API), and grpc as technologies and following design principles as DDD, hexagonal architecture, TDD, event-driven architecture, etc.

2015 - 2018.
Working in a dynamic XML parser and persistence system receiving more than 300 MQ messages per second and parsing and persisting them in oracle and couchbase.
This system receives all the info sent by the cash registers of the stores from one of the biggest retail enterprises in the world.
In this project, we were a group of 4 developers of which I was the team leader.
This application was developed using Java 8, spring and hibernate as frameworks, WebSphere MQ, couchbase, and oracle as technologies and it's deployed in WebSphere.
This application was awarded as the best IT project of the year, competing with more than 200 projects.

roles.name: Desarrollo y gestión de proyectos TIC.

challenges.description:
Popular servicios financieros (PSF).
1.- Maintenance of J2ee web applications and applications developed in c language.

Used technologies and tools: Java EE, struts, maven, subversion, websphere, oracle, eclipse, spring, hibernate, jstl, git, c.

roles.name: Desarrollo y gestión de proyectos TIC

challenges.description:
1. Maintenance of applications.
2. Analysis, design and development of new applications in the TGT area (store management terminal).
Defining the tech solution to implement, studying the possibilities and deciding which is the most appropriate for the TGT environment. Requirements analysis tasks and decision making of the best possible solution.
Interrelation with technical areas for organization of responsibilities around the technical solution to implement. Taking requirements with business and monitoring the status of tasks.
Monitoring of cross-cutting tasks. Executing the tasks of the area.
3. Customer management - Business: project monitoring with Business: SS.CC. and chains.
4. Vendor monitoring: planning tasks, assigning vendor development groups (up to four people) and monitoring the status of tasks. Using agile methodologies (Scrum) for this.

Used technologies and tools: Java EE, struts, maven, subversion, websphere, eclipse, spring, hibernate, jstl, ant, jira. InfoSphere Data Architect, Scrum, OpenProject.

organization.name: Hospedaxes - Desarrollo de negocio en Internet

roles.name: Desarrollo y gestión de proyectos TIC

challenges.description:
Development of different B2B, B2C and B2E projects, for different companies.
Client management, meetings with business to take requirements and follow-up of projects.
Management of tasks and development groups of up to 4 people.
Requirements analysis, design and development of new applications.
Maintenance of applications.

Used technologies: LAMP ( linux, apache, MySQL, php), framework CakePHP.

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription:
For me it's important to work to an enterprise making you feel like you're at home and where i always feel valued.
Working in projects giving value to the society and where i can grow as worker and as person.
